TopicTitle: Larger, heavier landing legs, and coming in a couple of hours.. Fins!

Articles.Content:
Hi all! first time posting anything, but I saw in the requests a wish for larger landing legs. now these aren\'t pretty but they do seem to work. Jeb likes bouncing with em ;D

enjoy.

P.S. kinda heavy but very tough

ok these are some test pics of the new 1 meter fins. they still need textures, but I can knock those out fairly fast (bounced on these also.. jeb disapproved.. they didn\'t explode )

ok the 1m are on hold for a bit, they had a few mesh issues. here however are the 2 meter fins, sorry about the textures, I\'ll be working on them more later.
I would download them.
Are they heavy? Reliable? Download link?

Now were talking BFE-5000 style!

P.S post a link!

Now were talking BFE-5000 style!

P.S post a link!

Its on the bottom of the main post as an attachment

Those legs are AWESOME.

They appear to have a problem with their collision though.

I tried landing on the KSP base terrain and a few seconds after succespul touchdown, the legs started sinking into the ground!

A few seconds more and the lander is shot up in the air (when the game realize that to solid object are not supposed to share the same volume of space) and torn appart!

Now THAT\'S KERBAL!!!

Hmm... Hadn\'t noticed that lil problem I\'ll take a look and see if I can fix it. also, more parts on the way. I have a horrid addiction.... old time sci fi. so I think some fins for the ships are next

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOA THATS HUGE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

thats what she said
Looks like the solution for landing a direct ascent mission on the moon

Land the entire Saturn V on the Mun? Can now!

Now does anyone have a really long rope ladder handy?
and not just these. I\'m in the process of making fins for 1m 1.75, 2 and 3 meter hulls. I like having the whole ship with me.. just in case
The ultimate in take everything with you packing! Includes the ktichen sink!
This is relevant to my interests, post a link!
Sorry folks. real life interupted yesterday and I got delayed. am getting back to work now tho
2m fins are attached now have fun with em

cool lander legs

Now, to land a WHOLE Saturn V in the Mun...

--- copying from another thread ---

Very nice model, Mary! Maybe even too large, this time What program did you use to make the models? I could try and scale them back about 50%... maybe I could make a range of sizes and post a .zip, so everyone could use what they prefer. Blender works with this format, maybe?
I used 3dmax 2012 to make them, and if you like play around with them. they were just fast throw togethers
Now we just need those lander legs...
Bump for great justice and the ability to use these legs properly!
are the legs not downloadable the rar shows as a php...if its correct what do i do with it

are the legs not downloadable the rar shows as a php...if its correct what do i do with it

Are you using firefox?
on firefox myself, and they are dling as php...
That\'s a problem with firefox itself-unfortunately I don\'t know of any solution except to use something else.
Happening on Firefox for me as well, first time I\'ve had the problem - must be related to the Firefox 8 upgrade that happened yesterday.
